thread.title: 2 Shreveport police corporals on leave while shooting probed
thread.title_full: 2 Shreveport police corporals on leave while shooting probed - FOX 8 WVUE New Orleans News, Weather, Sports, Social

author: cbs8
title: 2 Shreveport police corporals on leave while shooting probed
text:
SHREVEPORT, La. (AP) - Two members of the Shreveport Police Department are on paid leave while the department investigates the fatal shooting of a suspect.
On Saturday, the department identified them as Cpl. Timothy Adgate and Cpl. Ryan Owen.
The shooting happened Thursday. Police say Adgate was in full uniform when he was responding to a call and spotted 38-year-old Lawrence Green carrying a knife.
Cpl. Breck Scott says in a Saturday news release that Green refused to drop the weapon and, instead, charged at Adgate.
Adgate fired several times. Scott said Owen arrived on the scene as the shots were fired. Both corporals were placed on paid leave in accordance with the department's policy following an officer-involved shooting.
